item.title: DC Dialect Rationale
item.description: Introduction Value (channel) semantics Canonicalization Introduction DC (Dynamic Control) IR describes independent, unsynchronized processes communicating data through First-in First-out (FIFO) communication channels. This can be implemented in many ways, such as using synchronous logic, or with processors. The intention of DC is to model all operations required to represent such a control flow language. DC aims to be strictly a control flow dialect - as opposed to the Handshake dialect, which assigns control semantics to all SSA values.
